intro: Pectis tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed pectis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its slender stems and narrow leaves help reduce water loss, while its yellow flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Pectis tenuicaulis is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
